str2: A companion, comrade, friend. From etes; a comrade.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From para and eimi; to be near, i.e. At hand; neuter present participle time being, or property.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From epi and ballo; to throw upon; specially to reflect; impersonally, to belong to.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From kratos; to use strength, i.e. Seize or retain.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
